Ingredients.1: 2  fresh chile de arbol peppers, or to taste

Ingredients.2: 3 medium avocados - peeled, pitted, and mashed (one pit reserved)

Ingredients.7: 2 pinches garlic powder, or to taste

Directions.1: Preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C). Arrange chile peppers on a baking sheet.

Directions.2: Toast chile peppers in the preheated until browned, about 7 minutes. Remove stems.

Directions.3: Mix avocados, onion, and roma tomatoes together in a bowl.

Directions.4: Blend canned tomatoes, cilantro, toasted chile peppers, garlic powder, and salt in a blender until smooth. Pour about half the blended tomato mixture into avocado mixture. Reserve remaining tomato mixture for another use or for dipping.

Directions.5: Squeeze lime juice into avocado mixture and gently stir until evenly combined. Transfer guacamole to a smaller serving bowl; place reserved avocado pit in the middle to prevent browning.
